title: Trump holds off on 10% tariff threat against BRICS nations, but reiterates ultimatum
content: The Trump administration is holding off on immediately imposing a 10% tariff on Brics nations, despite President Trump's warning of trade penalties for countries embracing "anti-American policies." The tariff will only be activated if specific Brics nations take steps seen as directly hostile to US interests.

title: Trump releases tariff letters: Japan, Korea to face 25% US duties from August 1
content: US President Trump has announced new tariff rates effective August 1, 2025, impacting trade partners. Letters sent to Japan and Korea reveal a 25% tariff. Meanwhile, Trump warned of additional tariffs on nations associated with the BRICS bloc, accusing them of anti-Americanism.

title: Musk posts 'arrest counter' of Epstein case; fresh dig at Trump?
content: Elon Musk posted an "arrest counter" on X, highlighting zero arrests in the Jeffrey Epstein case, seemingly targeting Donald Trump. This follows reports that the DOJ and FBI found no evidence Epstein was murdered or blackmailed powerful figures. Musk previously alleged Trump's name appears in sealed documents related to the case.

title: Virat, Anushka spotted together at Wimbledon; pic goes viral - more photos inside
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma graced Wimbledon 2025 on Day 8, adding star power to the Royal Box. Their appearance, alongside Roger and Mirka Federer, drew attention amidst thrilling matches featuring Djokovic, Navarro, and Sinner. Wimbledon 2025 has attracted numerous high-profile figures, solidifying its status as a magnet for celebrities and global icons.

title: 'Where am I safe?': Woman narrates face-off with MNS leader's son
content: Social media influencer Rajshree More accused Rahil Shaikh, son of an MNS leader, of abuse and threats following a road accident in Mumbai. Shaikh, allegedly drunk, hurled slurs and invoked his MNS affiliation. More claimed she was targeted for supporting inclusivity and faced threats from MNS workers demanding an apology. Police have booked Shaikh for multiple offenses, including drunk driving.

title: Tesla board urged to question Elon Musk by former DOGE adviser
content: Former DOGE advisor James Fishback is critical of Elon Musk's decision to form the America Party, citing concerns about Musk's focus on Tesla. Fishback's firm, Azoria Partners, has postponed the launch of its Tesla ETF due to potential conflicts with Musk's CEO responsibilities. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent also suggested Musk should prioritize his companies over political endeavors.

title: Red-faced Pak army chief makes desperate claim after India exposes axis
content: Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, refuted claims of external assistance during the recent conflict with India, dismissing them as false and an attempt to undermine Pakistan's capabilities. He criticized India for involving other nations in a bilateral issue and warned of a strong response to any future aggression.

title: Akash Deep: A Mohammed Rafi fan who once called cricket ‘ameeron ka khel,’ is now India’s hero
content: Akash Deep lost his father and elder brother in six months when he was 18. During the second wave of the coronavirus pandemic, after struggling to procure an oxygen cylinder for his mother, she survived. Earlier this year, while undergoing rehab at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru, he was busy Googling the best doctor for liver cancer in India to treat his elder sister. Fast forward to the last week at Edgbaston, he produced two great spells to dismantle England’s top order and led India to a win, and to add to that, earned himself a song from the Brummies.

title: Gifts from Modi carry Ayodhya’s spiritual legacy and folk artistry abroad
content: During Prime Minister Modi's visit from July 2-5, India gifted culturally significant items to leaders in Argentina and Trinidad & Tobago, aiming to strengthen bilateral ties. Argentina received a hand-etched silver lion and a Madhubani painting, while Trinidad & Tobago was presented with a Kalash containing sacred Sarayu water and a silver replica of the Ayodhya Ram Temple.

title: US Air Force halts SpaceX Rocket Project: Reason may be Elon Musk’s comments on…
content: The U.S. Air Force has suspended its plan to collaborate with SpaceX for hypersonic rocket cargo deliveries from Johnston Atoll due to environmental concerns. Biologists and experts feared the project would endanger numerous seabirds nesting on the remote Pacific wildlife refuge.

title: 'Mahi bhai, keep playing': Indian cricketer wishes Dhoni on his 44th birthday
content: MS Dhoni celebrated his 44th birthday amid fervent wishes, with fans hoping to see him continue in the IPL. Despite age and a knee issue, he led CSK admirably in IPL 2025 after Ruturaj Gaikwad's injury. Recently inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame, Dhoni's future in IPL 2026 remains uncertain, hinging on his hunger, fitness, and team requirements.

title: 'Even if India lose the series ...' - Yograj after India beat England at Edgbaston
content: Former Indian cricketer Yograj Singh urged to support Gautam Gambhir. This comes after India's victory at Edgbaston, where Shubman Gill led the team to victory over the hosts and leveled the series 1-1. Yograj urged critics to back Gambhir, highlights Gambhir's positive contribution to Indian cricket. India take on England at Lord's on Thursday.

title: Bill Gates out of world’s 10 richest man list; net worth falls 30% in 7 days
content: Bill Gates has fallen out of the top ten richest people due to a recalculation reflecting his significant charitable donations. His net worth decreased by $52 billion, moving him to twelfth place, while Steve Ballmer, his former assistant and Microsoft's ex-CEO, now ranks higher with $172 billion.

title: AB de Villiers makes massive MS Dhoni revelation on birthday: 'It was very difficult to ...'
content: AB de Villiers honoured MS Dhoni on his 44th birthday, acknowledging his intimidating presence and remarkable career. Dhoni's captaincy led India to victory in three major ICC tournaments. Former selector Kiran More recognised Dhoni's aggressive batting style. Dhoni's recent induction into the ICC Hall of Fame celebrates his significant contributions to cricket.

title: IND vs ENG: Vaughan lambasts England player after loss - 'He has to count himself fortunate'
content: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has strongly criticised Zak Crawley's inconsistent Test performance, questioning his place despite a recent 65 against India. Geoffrey Boycott echoed these concerns, citing Crawley's ingrained flaws and insufficient run-scoring. India's victory at Edgbaston, fueled by Akash Deep's bowling, intensified scrutiny on England's team selection, including Chris Woakes' declining performance, prompting calls for strategic changes.

title: Climate justice a moral duty, not an option: PM Modi at Brics Summit
content: During India's Brics presidency, Prime Minister Modi envisions redefining the bloc with a focus on resilience, innovation, cooperation, and sustainability. He emphasized climate justice as a moral duty and advocated for global collaboration on health solutions, highlighting the interconnectedness of planetary and human well-being.

title: Travis Kelce holds off on proposing to Taylor Swift
content: Amidst swirling speculation, sources indicate that Travis Kelce is unlikely to propose to Taylor Swift imminently. While their bond is strong, Kelce reportedly plans to wait until his NFL retirement before making it official, prioritizing his football career. Swift, meanwhile, is focusing on personal growth and enjoying downtime after her Eras Tour, spending quality time with Kelce and family.

title: Trevor Lawrence’s baby girl glows in star-spangled 4th of July debut
content: Trevor Lawrence's daughter, Shae, made a patriotic splash on Instagram, celebrating her first Fourth of July and six-month milestone. The Jaguars quarterback, fresh off a $275 million contract extension, is drawing strength from his growing family as teammates voice their support. Fans now have another reason to cheer for Lawrence beyond the field.

title: Larsa Pippen drops massive update about her big day with new beau Jeff Coby
content: Larsa Pippen, Scottie Pippen's ex-wife, has revealed details about her relationship with Jeff Coby, a professional basketball player. She shared that they are on a positive path and hinted at engagement plans, discussing her preferred diamond cuts. Larsa was particularly touched by Coby's family-oriented nature, citing an instance where he was teaching his niece mathematics.

title: 'Patak patak ke marenge': BJP MP Dubey targets Thackerays amid language row
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's inflammatory remarks against those opposing Hindi imposition in Maharashtra have ignited a political firestorm. Dubey's threat to "thrash" Hindi speakers' detractors drew sharp criticism from Shiv Sena (UBT) and other opposition parties, who accused the BJP of attempting to divide the state for electoral gains.

title: Tesla free-fall: Musk fights Trump, loses Xi - 'America Party' adds to chaos
content: Tesla shares plummeted following escalating tensions between Elon Musk and Donald Trump, compounded by declining vehicle deliveries. Musk's launch of the "America Party" further unsettled investors, already concerned about Trump's potential impact on Tesla's subsidies and Musk's divided attention. Tesla faces challenges in China, losing market share to domestic competitors like BYD and Xiaomi.

title: Bihar horror: 5 of family killed in Purnea over witchcraft, black magic suspicions
content: In Bihar's Purnea district, a horrific incident unfolded where five family members were allegedly murdered and their bodies burned due to suspicions of witchcraft. Police have arrested three individuals in connection with the crime, which occurred in Tetma village. The killings may have been triggered by the recent death of a child, leading to accusations of black magic.

title: Russell Wilson’s Marvel debut: Wife Ciara celebrates with sweet shoutout;
content: Ciara supports Russell Wilson as his clothing label, 3BRAND, appears in Marvel's Ironheart. The brand made its TV debut in the Disney+ series. Wilson shared his excitement on social media. Ciara also expressed her pride. 3BRAND's appearance raises its profile in fashion and entertainment. The couple's business bond continues to grow. Their influence has now reached a global superhero stage.

title: 'Boosted momentum': Pirate Software as Stop Killing Games hits 1 million signatures
content: The Stop Killing Games petition surpassed a million signatures, fueled by an unexpected twist. Pirate Software's criticism sparked a social media backlash, ironically boosting the movement as supporters rallied against his perceived villain narrative. Despite his claims of minimal impact, the controversy surrounding his stance unified SKG advocates, injecting fresh energy into the campaign.

title: The Xi question: Is China's 'leader for life' planning his exit?
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping is reportedly delegating authority to key Communist Party institutions, sparking speculation about a potential power transition or retirement plans. This shift comes amid economic pressures, including trade tensions with the US and a housing market slump.

title: Russian minister ends life hours after being fired by Putin
content: Former Russian transport minister Roman Starovoit allegedly died by suicide with an awarded firearm shortly after being dismissed by President Vladimir Putin. His sacking followed significant flight cancellations and delays at Moscow's Sheremetyevo and St Petersburg's Pulkovo airports, reportedly due to Ukrainian drone attacks. Andrey Nikitin has been appointed as the acting transport minister.

title: Politics isn’t rocket science: Why Musk cannot beat Trump
content: A few months ago, right after Trump reclaimed the White House, he couldn’t stop gushing about his friend Elon. When SpaceX’s Starship booster landed back on its chopstick arms after a test flight, Trump said at a campaign rally: “Did you see the way that sucker landed today? That’s the greatest thing I’ve ever seen. Elon is an absolute genius – nobody else could ever do that.”

title: China goes off the rails after PM wishes Dalai Lama on his b'day
content: China has lodged a formal protest with India following Prime Minister Modi's birthday greetings to the Dalai Lama and the attendance of Indian officials at his 90th birthday celebrations. Beijing views the Dalai Lama as a separatist and accuses India of interfering in its internal affairs.

title: Shubman Gill effect! Former batter warns England - 'Come up with an answer'
content: Mark Butcher lauded Shubman Gill's composure and technique as India's Test captain, highlighting his success in Virat Kohli's former position. Gill's impressive form in the England series, with 585 runs, has solidified his position. Butcher also praised KL Rahul's consistency and Yashasvi Jaiswal's hunger for runs, calling Jaiswal a generational talent.

title: Language row: RSS backs regional languages for primary education
content: Amidst the ongoing language debate, the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) advocates for primary education in local languages. This statement follows the rollback of the three-language policy by Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu. The RSS emphasizes that all Indian languages are national languages.

title: Read: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Bollywood is buzzing with activity! R. Madhavan's youthful look at 55 has fans in disbelief, while Kajol reflects on how 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai' would be perceived today. Saira Banu lovingly remembers Dilip Kumar, and Parag Tyagi clarifies rumors about their dog Simba's health. Boney Kapoor is overjoyed at daughter Anshula's engagement, marking a heartwarming moment for the family.

title: After 'I will try to score 200 next time' remark, Suryavanshi now scores ...
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the young batting prodigy, followed up his record-breaking century with a composed 33 against England U19. His innings provided a solid start for India, who were interrupted by rain after posting 164/7. Suryavanshi's ambition to score a double-century, inspired by Shubman Gill, fuels anticipation for the final Youth ODI as he aims to fulfill his dream.

title: Iranian prez accuses Tel Aviv of attempting to assassinate him
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian claimed that Israel attempted to assassinate him by bombing the location of a meeting he was attending. In an interview with Tucker Carlson, Pezeshkian stated that Israel was responsible for the failed attempt, clarifying that the United States was not involved. However, he did not specify when this alleged assassination attempt occurred.

title: Wimbledon: Federer greeted with roaring applause after surprise appearance - Watch
content: Roger Federer and his wife Mirka graced Wimbledon on Day 8, receiving a warm welcome as they headed to the Royal Box. Federer, an eight-time Wimbledon champion, looked dapper in a navy blue suit, while Mirka wore a white dress. The Tennis great was welcomed with roaring applause by the crowd as he made his way to his seat.

title: Trump backs Washington Commanders’ old name; calls new one lacking ‘same ring
content: Donald Trump has once again voiced his opinion on the Washington Commanders' name, stating he would not have changed it. His remarks come as the team considers a potential stadium deal at the RFK Stadium site. Trump suggested that winning could improve the perception of the current name, but he still prefers the original.

title: 'Happy' to play with CSK captain, Prithvi Shaw joins Maharashtra - details inside
content: Prithvi Shaw is set to represent Maharashtra in the upcoming 2025/26 domestic season, securing a no-objection certificate from Mumbai. Shaw expressed gratitude to the Mumbai Cricket Association, citing the move as crucial for his growth. He looks forward to joining talents like Ruturaj Gaikwad and believes Maharashtra's progressive cricketing infrastructure will positively impact his career.

title: Uddhav asks 'did Pahalgam terrorists join BJP?'; takes 'washing powder' jab
content: Uddhav Thackeray criticized BJP regarding the Pahalgam terror incident. He questioned the whereabouts of the terrorists. Thackeray's remarks followed BJP leaders comparing the Hindi-Marathi row to the Pahalgam attack. Ashish Shelar equated the pain of the terror attack with the violence against Hindi speakers. Sanjay Raut condemned Shelar's comparison. Nishikant Dubey likened opposition parties to terrorists amid the language controversy. Dubey's statements further fueled the ongoing debate.

title: NPS vs UPS: Big move for govt employees! NPS tax benefits now under UPS
content: To boost the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), the Finance Ministry has extended National Pension System (NPS) income tax benefits to it. This move addresses tax treatment concerns, potentially increasing UPS adoption among central government employees. The deadline to switch from NPS to UPS has been extended to September 30, 2025, allowing more time for assessment.

title: Chess | ‘Carlsen’s respect for Gukesh is only going to grow’ – What does it even mean?
content: Magnus Carlsen secured victory at the Super United Rapid and Blitz in Croatia, overshadowing reigning World Champion Gukesh Dommaraju. Despite Carlsen's recent criticisms and subtle jabs towards Gukesh's abilities, the young challenger has consistently responded with strong performances on the board. This rivalry marks a significant transition in world chess, reminiscent of Carlsen's own rise to challenge established legends.

title: Drunk, shirtless MNS leader's son abuses woman, flaunts father's clout; FIR filed
content: Raj Thackeray's MNS faced criticism after a video surfaced showing an MNS leader's son, Rahil Shaikh, verbally abusing a Marathi-speaking woman following a car accident. Rahil, allegedly intoxicated, flaunted his father's political connections during the incident. Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Nirupam questioned MNS's commitment to Marathi pride in light of the event.

title: Watch: Thief Abandons Bike, Flees After Guards Stop Him In Delhi Society
content: A routine security check at Delhi's Press Enclave Society turned into a dramatic chase on Monday afternoon, when guards identified and attempted to catch a repeat offender who had previously stolen inverters from the residential colony.

title: 2 Arrested In Connection With Gopal Khemka Murder Case: Police
content: Two persons have been arrested in connection with the murder of Patna-based industrialist Gopal Khemka, including the man who had pulled the trigger, a senior police officer said on Monday.

title: Iran President Says Israel Attempted To Assassinate Him
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said in an interview that Israel, which last month fought a 12-day war with Iran, had attempted to assassinate him.

title: Record-Breaking Temperatures In June Around The World
content: From Nigeria to Japan, Pakistan to Spain, the month of June was the hottest ever recorded in 12 countries and was exceptionally warm in 26 other countries.

title: 'Take Steps To Stop Sand Mining Along Yamuna': Delhi Chief Minister To Yogi Adityanath
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has written to her Uttar Pradesh counterpart Yogi Adityanath, urging immediate action to curb illegal sand mining along the Yamuna River near the Delhi-UP border.

title: "Relationship Has Been...": Trump Slaps 25% Tariffs On Japan, South Korea
content: US President Donald Trump said he was slapping 25 percent tariffs on imports from Japan and South Korea, in his first letters to trading partners ahead of a deadline to reach a deal.

title: What PM Modi Gifted To Argentine, Trinidad & Tobago Leaders
content: As part of deepening diplomatic ties, India has presented a series of culturally significant gifts to the top leadership of Argentina, and Trinidad & Tobago.

title: Rs 10,000 Crore Sanctioned In Union Budget For Bihar Rail Network: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday said Rs 10,000 crore has been sanctioned in this year's Union Budget for strengthening rail infrastructure in Bihar.

title: Poll Body Fact Checks Mallikarjun Kharge's Post On Voter List Revision
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has fact checked Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's post on the special intensive revision (SIR) exercise, or voter list revision, being carried out in Bihar ahead of the assembly election.

title: Video: In 'Pushpa'-Esque Scene, Lakhs Of Logs Float Down Stream In Himachal Pradesh
content: In a scene that could have been straight out of the blockbuster 'Pushpa: The Rise', wooden logs worth crores were spotted floating down a stream in Himachal Pradesh.

title: 60 Years Of Disaster: All Solutions Lead To Dead-End In An Uttarakhand Zone
content: Located around 16 kilometres from Srinagar, Sirobagad is an active landslide zone where fallen debris leads to road closures almost daily, and often leads to accidents too.

title: Kaladan Project To Be Ready By 2027, Will Benefit Northeast: Union Minister
content: The distance between Mizoram's Aizawl and West Bengal's Kolkata will be shortened by 700 km by 2027, as India with the help of Myanmar will be able to operationalise the Kaladan Multi Modal Transit Transport Project (KMMTTP) by then.

title: Centre's Major Push To Revive J&K Tourism After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: In a major push to revive tourism in Jammu and Kashmir, a two-day conference of top tourism officials from across the country has begun in Srinagar.

title: Businessman With 3 Identities Fought 2019 Polls, Rakhi Sawant In Tow
content: Mukesh Kumar, the chairman and managing director of the listed firm Debock Industries Ltd, had three identities - real estate businessman, agriculture equipment dealer, and politician.

title: "Too Drunk To Remember He Was Half-Naked, But...": Woman On MNS Leader's Son
content: Recounting her harrowing experience after a Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) leader's son rammed his car into hers and then abused and threatened her, nail artist Rajshree More has said the man was so drunk he couldn't remember he was half-naked.

title: "Extraordinary": Hiker Rescued By Chihuahua After Falling In Swiss Glacier Crevasse
content: When it comes to mountain rescues, St. Bernards may have met their match, with a Chihuahua being hailed for helping save a man who fell into a glacier crevasse in Switzerland.

title: "World Revolves Around...": DY Chandrachud Explains Why Moving Out Not Easy
content: The former Chief Justice has now spoken exclusively with NDTV about his daughters Priyanka and Mahi, who are in his foster care,

title: "Will Define BRICS In New Form Under India's Chairmanship": PM Modi In Brazil
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said India would redefine the BRICS grouping under its upcoming chairmanship by focusing on "Building Resilience and Innovation for Cooperation and Sustainability."

title: 9 Dead, 33 Injured As Bus Overturns In Punjab's Hoshiarpur
content: A mini bus overturned near Sagran village of Hoshiarpur district on Monday, leaving nine people dead and 33 others injured, police said.

title: Desert To Siachen, No Hiding From India's Homegrown Mobile Artillery: 10 Points
content: India is set to test a homegrown mobile artillery gun that can be deployed anywhere, from Rajasthan's desert to Siachen's icy heights. The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has named it Advanced Towed Artillery Gun System (ATAGS).

title: ECI says 36.47% of enlisted voters have submitted enumeration forms for Bihar SIR
content: The names of all voters who have submitted the forms will be included in the draft Electoral Rolls to be published on August 1

title: Union Tourism Minister Shekhawat appreciates uptick in tourist footfall in Kashmir
content: He said the regular visits of Ministers and inter-Ministerial coordination meetings were helping in the revival of tourism

title: In Bihar SIR challenge, Supreme Court refers to 1977 verdict that says EC was not meant to be exalted as a ‘law unto itself’
content: Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia refers to the court’s observation that ‘a free and fair election based on universal adult franchise is the basic’, and that powers of the EC under Article 324 must not end up creating a ‘constitutional despot’

title: Big businesses are growing bigger but it’s not helping the economy grow: Congress
content: Congress general secretary (communications) Jairam Ramesh says concentration of resources in industry has raised prices for consumers and is one of the main sources of inflation. The Modi government is fixated on big businesses instead of betting big on small businesses, he says

title: Normalcy is returning in Manipur, says Sunil Ambekar
content: Sharing the Sangh’s plan to mark its centenary, Sunil Ambekar says the organisation is looking to reach out to every village and every house

title: 50,000 maritime sector jobs for northeast youth planned, says Sonowal
content: The Minister of Ports, Shipping, and Waterways said India’s ports are now globally competitive, with nine of them ranking in the world’s top 100

title: Crores of workers will join July 9 strike, claim trade unions
content: They say workers have supported the 17-point charter of demands of the strike, called against Union Government’s policies

title: House sites will be distributed to all beneficiaries in Gannavaram soon, says A.P. Energy Minister
content: Calls upon the public to make the most of the schemes being implemented by the government, and enquires about the disbursement of pensions and other benefits

title: BBMP proposed to be split up into five corporations
content: The proposed five corporations have been carved out in such a way that the maximum variance in revenue generation among them is ₹100 Crore

title: Sakambari festival commences at Indrakeeladri
content: Presiding deity decorated as ‘Sakambari Devi’ with fruit, vegetables, green leaves and flowers on the first day of the three-day festival

title: Polluting cooking fuel users may be at a higher risk of cognitive impairment finds study in Karnataka
content: The study, published in The Lancet found that users of only polluting cooking fuel, primarily rural women, had significantly lower scores in global cognition, visuospatial ability and executive functions

title: Karnataka commercial vehicle operators demand inclusion in FASTag annual toll scheme
content: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways recently unveiled an annual FASTag pass scheme for non-commercial vehicles at a fixed cost of ₹3,000, aiming to streamline toll payments and promote digital transactions

title: Kapil Dev expresses interest in partnering with Telangana to transform sports ecosystem
content: The legendary cricketer and film actor Ajay Devgan called on Chief Minister Revanth Reddy in New Delhi on Monday

title: A.P.’s Foreign Medical Graduates look for internships in other States, thanks to regulatory tangles
content: More than 250 FMGs have reportedly applied for internships in Telangana and other States as they are unable to get necessary clearances from Andhra Pradesh Medical Council for various reasons related to their online study during the COVID pandemic, which is seriously jeopardising their career

title: Party high command wants Siddaramaiah to continue as CM, says Hebbalkar
content: The Minsiter has said that it is a good thing that the party has considered the extension of Siddaramaiah’s tenure

title: 'On wrong side again': BJP attacks Rahul's 'obsession' with China
content: The BJP has accused Rahul Gandhi of supporting Chinese military technology and undermining the Indian armed forces. Amit Malviya criticized Gandhi for questioning the use of Indian forces and spreading misinformation about the stock market. Malviya highlighted the Modi government's reforms and the growth of India's stock market, contrasting it with financial scandals during Congress rule.

title: 'Texas closer to his heart': Cong's swipe at PM Modi for silence over Mandi disaster
content: Congress has launched a strong critique against PM Modi, questioning his silence on the devastating floods in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi, where numerous lives have been lost. This criticism arose after the Prime Minister expressed condolences for the flood-related deaths in Texas, USA. The opposition party suggests a disparity in the Prime Minister's concern for domestic and international tragedies.

title: IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill shares most special Edgbaston moment - Watch
content: Shubman Gill expressed immense pride after India's dominant 337-run victory over England at Edgbaston, emphasizing the team's all-round performance and collective effort. He highlighted the significance of securing a historic Test win in a previously unconquered territory. Gill cherished the victory, particularly Siraj's catch, as a testament to the team's hard work and unity, marking it as a career highlight.

title: Grounded F-35 in Kerala: UK thanks India for support; says repairs 'under way'
content: A Royal Navy F-35B fighter, grounded in Thiruvananthapuram since June 14 due to an emergency landing, has been moved to a maintenance hangar for repairs. The UK Ministry of Defence expressed gratitude to Indian authorities for their support. British engineers arrived via RAF aircraft with specialized equipment to fix the aircraft, which experienced issues during refuelling.

title: RBI floating rate bond offers 8.05% return: FRSB outperforms most bank FDs, PPF
content: Reserve Bank of India keeps the Floating Rate Savings Bonds interest rate at 8.05% for July to December 2025. This rate is higher than many bank fixed deposits. These bonds offer safety and good returns. The rate is linked to National Savings Certificate and recalibrated every six months. These bonds are good for long-term conservative investors seeking steady income.

title: 'Centre handicapped': VP explains why no FIR against Justice Varma in cash row
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar highlighted the constraints faced by the government in registering an FIR in the Justice Yashwant Varma case, citing a decades-old judicial order.

title: Darshan case rerun? B'luru youth stripped, thrashed for obscene msg to minor
content: In Bengaluru, eight individuals were apprehended for kidnapping and assaulting a youth who allegedly threatened to reveal a minor girl's past relationships to her family. The victim and the girl were previously in a relationship, and after their separation, he threatened to expose her affairs.

title: 29.5 kg of gold from Kanaka Durga temple deposited under GMS scheme
content: As per the prevailing market rate of ₹9,010 per gram for 22-carat gold, the total estimated value of the deposited ornaments is approximately ₹26.58 crore

title: Immediately stop Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, say INDIA bloc leaders
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, Vikassheel Insaan Party and the Left parties say ECI should not create doubts in the minds of common people and end the complex processes

title: Chittoor police grant conditional permission for Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy’s visit to Bangarupalyam to meet mango farmers on July 9
content: This is not a public meeting. No rally or roadshow is permitted between the helipad and the market yard, says the SP

title: State conference to oppose smart meters and true-up charges on July 13
content: State government is implementing smart meters as part of the Central government’s privatisation drive, allege United Forum of People’s Organisations’ leaders

title: Arunachal Pradesh officials warned against violating Supreme Court judgment on Chakma-Hajong issue
content: The agenda of a meeting between the State’s Home Department officials and the representatives of an apex students’ body will attract contempt of court, a Delhi-based rights group said

title: Class tests mandatory every month: Minister
content: The plan is to assess school students’ academic performance and provide additional academic support to the needy. Discussions on implementing the academic master plan for schools also held.

title: 261 persons convicted in cases related to crime against women in one year in Andhra Pradesh
content: DGP Harish Kumar Gupta credits the increased conviction rate to the coordinated efforts of investigation officers, cyber and IT teams, Mahila Police, the Task Force, and support from the Prosecution Department

title: Two feared dead in stone quarry accident near Konni
content: Rescue personnel recover one body after several hours of intense search. Rescue operations called off by 7.30 p.m. on Monday due to bad weather, poor visibility

title: Foul smell lingers at Ariyamangalam dump yard despite biomining of waste being taken up
content: The dump yard, spread over 47 acres, is estimated to receive approximately 470 tonnes of garbage daily, in addition to several lakh cubic metres of accumulated (legacy) waste.

title: Sinking of MSC Elsa-3: Kerala files admiralty suit seeking ₹9,531-crore compensation for marine pollution, economic loss to fishers
content: High Court orders interim arrest of MSC Akiteta-2, currently at the Vizhinjam port, till July 10. State claims ₹8,626.12 crore for the damage due to pollution, ₹378.48 crore to restore the environment, and ₹526.51 crore for economic loss to fishers

title: Bridge construction linking Tirumarugal and Kilvelur gains momentum
content: People from villages such as Anaimanagalam and Kohur near Kilvelur and Okkur and Venagadangal near Tirumarugal had to take a detour of 8 km to reach the other side

title: SCR plans to install automatic block signalling in high-density routes of 1,700 km to help increase line capacity
content: Under the ABS, the movement of the trains is controlled by the automatic stop signals to ensure trains in the same direction follow each other at a safe distance without the risk of rear-end collision, railway officials explained; its installation has been taken up in a phased  manner over the years

title: Naidu unveils vision for crime-free Andhra Pradesh using tech tools
content: Chief Minister emphasises leveraging cutting-edge technology to strengthen law and order, ensure public safety, and modernise welfare delivery mechanisms

title: Woman seeks help to trace missing husband in Eluru
content: A total of 394 petitions received during the PGRS event, covering a wide range of issues from land disputes to pension requests and disability benefits

title: Kerala to draft women-friendly tourism policy
content: Main purpose of policy is to make Kerala a travel destination that appeals to women by revolutionising the travel and tourism industry of the State

title: MLB GMs tell their best (and wildest) trade stories: 'I had to go in the basement of the bar where all the liquor is being stored'
content: From texts during life events to the best deadline deals that never happened, MLB front office execs tell all.

title: Reese latest to blast WNBA refs: 'Has to be fixed'
content: Sky forward Angel Reese became the WNBA's latest high-profile figure to call out the league's officials, saying "it has to be fixed" and "I am tired of this s---."

title: Sources: Powell to Heat, Collins to Clips in trade
content: The Clippers, Jazz and Heat have agreed to a trade that sends Norman Powell to Miami, John Collins to Los Angeles, and Kevin Love, Kyle Anderson and a 2027 Clippers second-round pick to Utah, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Djokovic grinds out win to reach Wimbledon last 8
content: Novak Djokovic overcame an uncharacteristically unsteady start, coming through for a 1-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4 victory over 11th-seeded Alex de Minaur in the fourth round of Wimbledon on Monday.

title: Nats seek 'fresh approach,' fire Martinez, Rizzo
content: Headed into an off day and stuck in last place in the NL East, the Washington Nationals fired manager Dave Martinez and general manager Mike Rizzo on Sunday night, hours after a 6-4 loss at home completed a sweep by the Boston Red Sox.

title: Sources: OU AD Castiglione to leave full-time role
content: Oklahoma athletic director Joe Castiglione will retire from his full-time role during the upcoming school year, bringing an end to the longest-tenured run for a current AD in major college sports, sources told ESPN.

title: Durant to Rockets part of NBA-first 7-team trade
content: A series of moves going back to Kevin Durant's trade to the Houston Rockets before the draft ultimately became the first seven-team trade in NBA history.

title: York returning to Flyers on 5-year, $25.75M deal
content: Restricted free agent defenseman Cam York, who has 77 points in 235 games for the Flyers, has agreed to a five-year contract with the team worth $25.75 million.

title: Kershaw gets special ASG invite; no Soto, Betts
content: The MLB All-Star Game rosters will feature 19 first-timers -- and special commissioner's pick Clayton Kershaw -- as the pitchers and reserves were announced Sunday.

title: 📋 MLB draft guide: Latest intel for all 30 teams
content: Who will the Nationals take No. 1? Who is atop your team's board? Kiley McDaniel lays it all out as draft week arrives.

title: Who are the NFL's best running backs? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches, scouts and players from around the league ranked their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: NBA free agency superlatives: Best, worst, underrated moves
content: Which deals will impact the title race? Which will leave teams in regret by Christmas? Our NBA insiders make their picks.

title: USMNT's real test will be learning from Gold Cup final loss to Mexico
content: There were plenty of difficult lessons for the USMNT in the Gold Cup final loss to Mexico on Sunday. How Mauricio Pochettino & Co. respond will be telling.

title: All-Star rosters: Biggest snubs and other takeaways
content: Some of the game's biggest names are headed to Atlanta, but some deserving stars will be watching from home.

title: The most obscure MLB All-Stars ever
content: Hunter Goodman just became an All-Star -- not the first time an unfamiliar player is headed to Midsummer Classic.

title: What Nationals' overhaul means for their No. 1 draft pick, trade deadline plans
content: Washington fired its GM and manager as draft and trade season heat up. Here's how the fallout could play out.

title: From WrestleMania moves to showing off his jump shot: How Pete Carroll is rebuilding Raiders culture
content: Carroll's competitive nature and fun-loving spirit is palpable, and the Raiders are hoping their new approach will translate to wins.

title: Running back rankings: Who are the most reliable TD scorers?
content: From Jahmyr Gibbs and Derrick Henry to Bijan Robinson, we rank the running backs based on the most dependable at finding the end zone.

title: After a week of upsets, which Americans are still playing at Wimbledon?
content: Many top seeds have struggled, but Emma Navarro and Ben Shelton are among those who remain in the draw.

title: Gonzalo García proves he can be the reason Real Madrid win Club World Cup
content: With Real Madrid in the semifinals of the Club World Cup, the performances from youngster Gonzalo García could be the reason they go all the way.

title: Sources: Arsenal closing in on $76M Gyökeres deal
content: Arsenal are close to sealing a move for Sporting Lisbon forward Viktor Gyökeres, sources have told ESPN.

title: Poch: USMNT Gold Cup lessons 'priceless, painful'
content: United States coach Maurico Pochettino said his team had learned "priceless" lessons despite a "painful" 2-1 loss to rival Mexico during Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: Source: Atleti open to De Paul exit amid Miami links
content: Atlético Madrid are prepared to sell Rodrigo De Paul this summer if the Argentina midfielder refuses to sign a contract extension with the Rojiblancos in the coming weeks, a source has told ESPN.

title: Source: Liverpool to begin preseason on Tuesday
content: Liverpool players are set to report for preseason training on Tuesday, following the death of forward Diogo Jota, a source told ESPN.

title: Mexico takes down USMNT to win 10th Gold Cup
content: Edson Álvarez's second-half header gave Mexico a 2-1 win over the United States and a 10th Gold Cup title in a frenetic final at Houston's NRG Stadium on Sunday night.

title: Jiménez pays tribute to Jota after Gold Cup goal
content: Mexico striker Raul Jiménez paid tribute to his former teammate Diogo Jota after scoring a goal against the Untied States at the Gold Cup.

title: Ex-Barcelona, Croatia star Rakitić retires
content: Former Barcelona and Croatia midfielder Ivan Rakitić on Monday announced his retirement from football at the age of 37.

title: Sounders GK Frei taken from field in ambulance
content: Sounders goalkeeper Stefan Frei took an accidental knee to the head with seconds remaining in stoppage time and was taken off the field in an ambulance during his team's 1-1 draw with the Columbus Crew on Sunday.

title: MLS Power Rankings: As Vancouver slips, Nashville is new No. 1
content: Injury-hit Vancouver fell to the Galaxy, leaving the door open for Nashville to take top spot in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: 'I never doubted him': F1 celebrates Nico Hülkenberg's long-overdue first podium
content: In a 15-year F1 career, Nico Hülkenberg had never tasted podium champagne. That changed at Silverstone, an achievement celebrated up and down pit lane.

title: Remembering Ruffian 50 years after her breakdown at Belmont
content: The filly shattered her right front ankle in a match race against Kentucky Derby winner Foolish Pleasure.

title: USC Paralympian Ezra Frech is a pioneer under pressure
content: The two-time gold medalist is the first above-the-knee amputee recruited to a D-I track and field program.

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
